result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Edward Pendleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by defendant

10:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen Edward Pendleton in court. Right to atty recited, Defendant would like to proceed w/out counsel, Defendant would like to proceed w/plea/sentencing, Court in recess at 10:56 A.M., Case recalled at 11:15 A.M., appearances the same, Waiver of Right to Atty filed, Court accepts Waiver, State moves to orally amend Ct. 1 to Possession of THC, Misdemeanor, Atty Yaskal to file Amended Complaint today, Court accepts, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to: 1 day jail, 1 day sentence credit, Sentence is TIME SERVED, $579.00 fine/costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample
Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. May not leave the States of WI or MN w/o prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions.
Pretrial 3-4-22 at 11:30 am and Return date 3-22-22 at 10:45 am
Return date on March 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Allen Edward Pendleton appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Allison J Borsheim appeared by video for Allen Edward Pendleton. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. $500.00 signature bond. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. May not leave the State of WI or MN without prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 1:31 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.
